climbs.name: Castles in the Sand
climbs.fa: Jeff McKeough A. Frith, Corey McCue July 2020

content.description:
Stick clip recommended as the crux is down low. After sticking the crux, make a couple delicate moves past the first bolt, the climbing gets easier from here. Slab styles moves with pockets bring you to a small ledge, using a finger crack on your right and some small holds on the left you can head straight up to the anchors or venture in to the corner on the right for a slightly easier although dirtier finish.



First bolted line on the wall.

4 bolts with bolted anchors/rap rings.

climbs.name: Crack of Time
climbs.fa: Corey McCue Jeff McKeough Dylan Carson July 2020

content.description:
Start the same as Lichen and Vitamin D, then trend right to a small birch tree halfway up the wall. Move left around the tree to enter a left trending finger crack that eventually turns back to the right. Once back in line with the tree climb straight up on face holds to top out.



Same start as Lichen and Vitamin D

Trad, BD .3 to #2 with option for some nuts. Shared anchor

climbs.name: Just What the Doctor Ordered
climbs.fa: Jeff McKeough, A. Frith, A. Savoie June 2020

content.description:
Get your slab game on, crux is between 2nd and 3rd bolts. Some cool little features on this route



Currently the furthest right bolted line at The Sandbox

3 bolts, bolted anchor

climbs.name: Lichen and Vitamin D
climbs.fa: Jeff McKeough and A. Frith May 2020

content.description:
Start on some small flakes and blocky holds and move up to a significant horizontal seam. Pull past the seam and on to the upper slab with a varying fingers+/- crack that thins out near the top. Move slightly left to top out. (Shares bolted anchor with Crack of Time.)



First established route on The Sandbox wall


Trad, mostly small gear (finger and smaller) with option of #1 or #2 at horizontal seam. Shared bolted anchor.

pathTokens: Red Rock Mountain (aka Pet Wall, Pet Rock, Red Rock)

content.description: Stays shaded in the afternoon. Coolest place to be when the mid summer sun hits the main cliff.
